isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS - DIAGNOSTIC PROCEDURES FOR THE ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM - VREF Voltage Check

svcproc.title: V REF Voltage Check

figure.caption: V Ref Check with Master Diagnostics

step1.para: Connect a 0.5 kilo ohm jumper wire from the blue V REF pin to the green signal pin in the breakout tee. Check voltage on the EST.
Check V REF for 5 ± .5 volts with the sensor disconnected.

item.para: If the voltage reading is lower than expected, verify V REF for the other V REF sensors in the same V REF circuit.

svcproc.para: V REF B for APS/IVS, BAP
V REF C for Body builder accessories
V REF D for EOP, MAP, CMP, ICP

item.para: If other V REF sensors on the shared V REF circuit have expected V REF voltage, the harness wire from the splice point to the sensor connector is at fault. If the other sensors have lost the V REF voltage, disconnect the V REF sensors one at a time while checking V REF voltage. If V REF voltage returns after disconnecting a sensor, that sensor is shorting V REF to ground.

If V REF is suspected of shorting out intermittently during engine operation, use a breakout tee on the ICP or MAP sensor. While running the engine, jump the V REF pin to the signal pin to display V REF in master diagnostics .

note.para: Operation of the engine may be degraded slightly because the sensor will set an active Diagnostic Trouble Code and fault management will take over its function.
The ECM will not display a sensor signal voltage greater than 5 volts.

svcproc.para: If V REF is shorted high (voltage greater than 5 .5 volts), the signal voltage will be biased higher than its true reading. The MAP sensor is the most sensitive to this higher V REF voltage and will set an In-range Diagnostic Trouble Code.

When checking for Diagnostic Trouble Codes for a pressure sensor, check for MAP Diagnostic Trouble Codes. If MAP Diagnostic Trouble Codes are active, use a DMM to check V REF for a short to a voltage source higher than V REF. If MAP Diagnostic Trouble Codes are inactivethe voltage is not shorted high.
